bibl.title: Of Population
bibl.publisher: Longman, Hurst, Rees, Orme and Brown

note.p: Godwin's Answer to Malthus, as he describes it in the diary on the day of publication, challenging Thomas Malthus's An Essay on the Principle of Population (1798), which had argued that as population increases in a 'geometric ratio' (1, 2, 4, 8...) and food supply can only increase in an 'arithmetic ratio' (1, 2, 3, 4...), population must be kept in check by 'misery and vice'. Published in one octavo volume and priced at 18s.
